text: [Music]
some of the most common injuries that we
see in the emergency department have to
do with Falls whether it be fall from a
height fall from standing or fall off of
a bicycle
many of these are true accidents and
they can't be prevented although one
thing that we always encourage
particularly from the emergency
department is the use of helmets helmets
really work in New York City we see a
drastic difference often between
patients who are hit by a car on their
bike some of the people wearing helmets
simply have to replace their helmet and
are fine and some of the people who
aren't wearing helmets unfortunately
have injuries like skull fracture or
bleeding into their brain we see
bicycling injuries in people of all ages
nobody is immune and it's important that
whether you're a five-year-old beginning
cyclist or a 35 year old who's completed
the Tour de France it's important that
that you are a helmet
